item.title: Activity 1: Servo Motor Control
item.description:
Overview

In this activity, you will demonstrate your ability to wire and control a servo motor using an Arduino Uno. You’ll start by using Arduino’s built-in Sweep example, then modify the code to create your own custom movement pattern. This is an individual demonstration activity where you’ll show your understanding of motor control, circuit wiring, and Arduino programming.

item.title: Activity 2: Distance Sensors
item.description:
Overview

In this activity, you will wire and experiment with two types of distance sensors: an ultrasonic sensor (HC-SR04) and an infrared (IR) obstacle detection sensor. You’ll test how each sensor responds to different objects, surfaces, and distances. This is a team demonstration activity where you’ll show your understanding of sensor operation and explore their strengths and limitations.

Teams: Work in groups of 2-3 students

Due Date: Monday, February 3rd by 11:50 AM
